meanings.definition: The plural form of the word 'cain', meaning a mark or scar on the skin.
meanings.sent1: She had several cains on her arm from the accident.
meanings.sent2: The doctor examined the cains on the patient's back.
meanings.sent3: The little girl pretended her cains were battle scars from a dragon fight.
meanings.sent4: The old tree bore the cains of many lightning strikes.
meanings.sent5: The cains on the tree trunk told stories of past storms.

meanings.definition: The third person singular form of the verb 'cain', meaning to mark or scar.
meanings.sent1: He always cains his initials on his belongings.
meanings.sent2: The artist carefully cains each piece with intricate designs.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat managed to cains the curtains with its claws.
meanings.sent4: Time cains memories on our hearts like etchings on stone.
meanings.sent5: The sculptor cains his emotions into every masterpiece he creates.
